lines: WARNING - THIS EPISODE CONTAINS SUBJECT MATTER OF A SEXUAL NATURE.
This episode is not appropriate for you right now. Married folks or those with no social skills will either have to get divorced (not worth it!) or shape up to play. You can try again later.
Dave, a great-looking male friend, has asked if you would like to spend the night in his room. Are you ready for a night of romance?
*comment If not dating, this person becomes an ex-lover.
The last thing you remember before dozing peacefully off is, "was it as good for you as it was for me?" Then...
You are awakened by a loud ring of the telephone. HIS PARENTS ARE AT THE DESK DOWN THE HALL AND THEY ARE COMING RIGHT IN!
#PANIC AND TRY TO MAKE IT LOOK LIKE YOU ARE PREPARING BREAKFAST
#TRY TO GET DRESSED, MAKE THE BED AND LOOK LIKE YOU HAVE BEEN AWAKE FOR HOURS
#GET DRESSED BUT DON'T PANIC; LET THEM SEE YOU AS YOU ARE
His parents come up and notice that the room has a very musky smell to it. His mom recognizes it as the smell of fulfilled desires. She narrows her glance in your direction.
#MENTION THAT YOU WERE AN OVERNIGHT GUEST
Oh, the story about practicing your aerobics class together was very amusing. Now, how do you explain that pair of skimpy black panties peeking out from under the pillow?!

For SHAME! "Is THIS what you are going to college for?" they wonder. How do you think it feels for parents to come into their own child's room and be hit over the head with the evidence of their son's sexual exploits?
Their visit is ruined. But they'll get over it.
They came on their own -- next time they will probably give you fair warning. Dave apologizes for the commotion and looks like he's ready to start round two...

His parents are just as embarrassed as you are. For a few moments the visit is awkward. It was a nice sentiment for them to come visit their son, but next time they will probably give more warning before popping over.
Oh. They wonder if everyone who comes over wears their son's football shirt as attire.
Nice try, except for one thing -- you forgot to take Dave out of the bed before making it! He is the big lump to the left of the gym shorts.
That is very honest of you. I wonder how his parents will take it...

That might have been an acceptable response in the 60's, but we've gotten much more inhibited again since then. It is unlikely that even the most well-adjusted parents will see this kind of behavior as anything but rude and
inappropriate. They say a quick "hello" and "goodbye."
